intro: Lisianthius tetragonus, commonly known as the four-cornered lisianthius, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and native plant gardening.
